III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Title restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/4/24, a staff placed a youth in a choke hold against the
outside wall of the building by the front entrance after the youth
ran outside.
Investigation Consultant 1 was told this information by Youth A during a
face-to-face interview while at the facility on August 27, 2024.
Youth A reported either Staff 1 or Staff 2 had him in a choke hold
against the wall. Youth A stated it was not Supervisor because
Supervisor was standing directly in front of him talking to him
during the restraint.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on August 28, 2024,
while DHHS Worker was face to face with Youth A at the
facility. Youth A described walking into the staff breakroom and
Supervisor, Staff 1, and Staff 2 followed him into the room. Youth
A reported he was placed in a restraint by Staff 1 and Staff 2,
walked out of the breakroom, broke out of the restraint and ran
outside. Youth A stated once he was outside Staff 1 and Staff 2
put him on the wall, placed him in a restraint and either Staff 1 or
Staff 2 grabbed his neck. Youth A reported the hand was not on
his neck very long, but he could not breathe. Youth A denied
having any marks on his neck. Youth A stated he knows it was
not Supervisor because he could see Supervisor who was
standing in front of him telling him to calm down. Youth A
reported Supervisor told Staff 1 and Staff 2 to let Youth A go and
2

Staff 1 and Staff 2 went inside. Youth A denied this ever
happened before or having any issues with Staff 1 or Staff 2 prior
to this restraint. Youth A reported he has never seen any staff put
their hand around or up against any youth’s neck. Youth A
reported there were not any other youth present when this
occurred. Youth A stated he was placed in the standing restraint
outside for hitting one of the staff, but he could not recall what staff
he hit.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported he was called for assistance by either Staff 1
or Staff 2 who were in the breakroom with Youth A who was going
through staff lockers. Supervisor stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 used a
CPI turnaround technique to move Youth A out of the breakroom.
Supervisor described Youth A as pushing and fighting against
Staff 1 and Staff 2. Supervisor reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
disengaged from Youth A and Youth A ran outside. Supervisor
stated Staff 1, Staff 2, and himself followed Youth A outside.
Supervisor reported Youth A was threatening Staff 1 and Staff 2
getting in their faces and ended up hitting either Staff 1 or Staff 2
so Staff 1 and Staff 2 placed Youth A into a standing restraint.
Supervisor described Youth A as fighting the restraint the entire
time, moving his body back and forth and screaming. Supervisor
stated he has a good relationship with Youth A, so he stood
directly in front of him and began talking to Youth A while Staff 1
and Staff 2 stood on each side of Youth A holding Youth A’s arms.
Supervisor denied seeing Staff 1 or Staff 2 having their hand
against Youth A’s neck at any time during the restraint.
Supervisor stated it would have been impossible for either Staff 1
or Staff 2 to have their hand on Youth A’s neck because
Supervisor was standing directly in front of Youth A and each staff
were on either side of Youth A. Supervisor denied Youth A having
any injuries or Youth A saying anything about being in a choke
hold. Supervisor reported the restraint was done properly and did
not have any concerns.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
1 described not typically working with Youth A, but he came upon
a situation with Youth A and Staff 2 taking place outside by one of
the doors. Staff 1 stated Youth A broke the door and window, was
threatening staff and was placed in a high standing restraint. Staff
1 reported he was on Youth A’s right side and Staff 2 was on
Youth A’s left side while Supervisor talked with Youth A. Staff 1
described having his arm under Youth A’s arm holding his wrist on
3

the right side while Staff 2 was doing the same on Youth A’s left
side. Staff 1 denied ever having his hand by Youth A’s
neck/throat or choking Youth A at any point during the restraint.
Staff 1 denied seeing Staff 2 or Supervisor have their hand at
Youth A’s neck or throat. Staff 1 reported he did not have any
concerns with the restraint and felt it was done properly. Staff 1
stated Youth A never said anything to him about being choked or
not being able to breathe. Staff 1 reported he has never seen any
staff place their hand(s) on a youth’s neck.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
B described seeing Youth A in a restraint only one time in the
back of the building because Youth A was in a fight with another
youth. Youth B stated staff did what they were supposed to do.
Youth B reported he could not recall who the staff were that had
Youth A in a restraint. Youth B denied hearing Youth A say he
was ever choked or hurt by staff. Youth B stated he did not have
any concerns with how staff do restraints. Youth B described Staff
1 and Staff 2 as, “good staff, they do their jobs and everything
they need to do.” Youth B stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 do not look
anything alike and one can tell them apart easily.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Therapist reported Youth A never told her he was choked during a
restraint or express concerns about Staff 1 and/or Staff 2.
Therapist denied ever seeing any injuries on Youth A’s neck or
throat area.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
C described seeing Youth A in two different restraints. Youth C
denied ever seeing any staff assault or choke Youth A. Youth C
stated Youth A told him a few days ago while in a restraint a staff
choked him. Youth C reported he could not recall what staff Youth
A said it was that choked him. Youth C denied seeing any staff
choke a youth during a restraint. Youth C described Staff 1 and
Staff 2 as, “cool, genuine, likeable, and realistic.” Youth C stated
he did not have any concerns with how staff do restraints. Youth
C reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 do not look anything alike and have
two different skin tones.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on September 6, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at Staff 2’s
home. Staff 2 described being involving in a high standing
4

restraint with Youth A and Staff 1 outside the same day there was
an incident in the breakroom with Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth
A was punching him and Staff 1 so Youth A was placed in a
restraint with Staff 1 and himself standing on each side of Youth
A. Staff 2 described the restraint as standing shoulder to
shoulder, hip to hip and holding Youth A’s wrists. Staff 2 reported
a staff’s hands or arms would never be near a youth’s neck or
throat during a restraint. Staff 2 denied having his hands near
Youth A’s neck or throat area or chocking Youth A. Staff 2 stated
he never saw Staff 1 choke Youth A or have his hands near Youth
A’s neck or throat. Staff 2 reported Youth A never made any
comments of being choked or that he could not breathe during the
restraint. Staff 2 denied seeing any marks or bruises on Youth A’s
neck or throat area. Staff 2 stated there was a supervisor present
for the restraint but could not recall which supervisor. Staff 2
reported the supervisor was not part of the restraint, just there
watching and trying to de-escalate Youth A. Staff 2 stated the
restraint was done properly and did not have any concerns. Staff
2 described having a good relationship with Youth A and never
having any issues with him.
Video Review:
Video footage of 8/04/2024 outside the facility building of Youth A
being placed in a restraint was reviewed on 09/06/2024. Youth A
is seen going out the side doors, pushing a staff (cannot tell if
Staff 1 or Staff 2), then being placed in a standing restraint. Youth
A is fighting the restraint moving his body and arm back and forth.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 place Youth A in a standing restraint with Staff
1 standing to Youth A’s right side and Staff 2 standing on Youth
A’s left side. Youth A is fighting the restraint moving his body with
Staff 1 and Staff 2 moving along with Youth A and the three go out
of camera view. While the restraint is on video it does not show
Staff 1, Staff 2 or Supervisor having their hand near or against
Youth A’s neck.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report (IR) 191560238 for Youth A. Incident report
documents, Youth A punched Staff 1 and Staff 2 so was
placed in a standing restraint by Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Incident report documents, Supervisor was present talking
with Youth A. IR documents Youth A made a suicidal
statement and began making accusations that staff was
hitting him. Youth A asked to call CPS. Supervisor brought
a phone to Youth A to make the call, but Youth A said he
did not want to talk to CPS.
5

• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required CPI on 2/12/24.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 had three write ups not
related to restraints. Staff 2 completed the required CPI on
2/12/24.
• Supervisor’s personnel file: Supervisor had one write up not
related to restraints. Supervisor completed the required CPI
on 2/12/24.
• Behavior Support and Management Policy: Policy
documents restrictive intervention is used when a youths’
behavior would result in physical injury or imminent risk of
physical harm of the client, other client, staff members, or
others. None of the restraint types and techniques involve a
staff’s hands being placed near or on a youth’s neck.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff interviews and what
can be viewed on video neither Staff 1 nor Staff 2 had their
hand(s) near or around Youth A’s neck.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
